<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/apples-new-software-update-means-big-changes-ad-tracking?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tracker no Tracking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Facebook and apple" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDYzL2ZhY2Vib29rX2FuZF9hcHBsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, Apple is rolling out its <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/20/tech/ios-14-5-release-date/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">iOS 14.5 software update</a> for iPhone users, including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ability to unlock phones with your face while wearing a mask</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>217 new emoji to express emotions you didn’t even know you had</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Support for the new AirTag Bluetooth device tracker </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But there’s one particular iOS 14.5 update that’s less “oh neat!” and more “this could shake up the $105 billion mobile ad industry.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s called App Tracking Transparency</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With this new feature, apps will be required to ask for your permission to track your activity across the internet. That data is crucial to advertisers who want to use your internet history to show you ads you’re more likely to click on. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Problem for advertisers is, when you ask someone whether they want to be tracked or not, the majority say no. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So why is Apple doing it? </strong>It’s part of CEO Tim Cook’s push to <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/22254815/facebook-apple-privacy-ios-14-lawsuit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">add more privacy features</a> to Apple’s ecosystem. Here’s Cook at a privacy conference in January:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Technology does not need vast troves of personal data, stitched together across dozens of websites and apps, in order to succeed.”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“If a business is built on misleading users, on data exploitation, on choices that are no choices at all, then it does not deserve our praise. It deserves reform.”</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Sound like a business you know? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook took to App Tracking Transparency like a foot to a stray Lego piece. In a PR blitz following Apple’s announcement, it <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/02/26/971367875/why-is-facebook-launching-an-all-out-war-on-apples-upcoming-iphone-update?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argued</a> that small businesses would be hurt without the ability to send users targeted FB ads. Whether Facebook’s ad biz will be dinged as much as it says it will is unclear, but other apps like Snap and Bumble have <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-04-23/apple-s-new-iphone-privacy-feature-may-help-facebook-google?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> that Apple’s moves could be harmful.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Apple’s aggressive privacy measures are putting competitors on the back foot, but they could also invite even more antitrust scrutiny to its dominance of the app economy. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/us-pledges-help-india-brutal-second-wave?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
US, European Allies Pledge to Help India
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/25/us-pledges-help-india-brutal-second-wave" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Indian hospital" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODU2L2luZGlhbl9ob3NwaXRhbC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mayank Makhija/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After taking a mostly “not my problem” approach to India’s brutal second wave of the coronavirus, yesterday the US said <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/25/us-pressed-to-lift-export-ban-to-help-india-fight-surge-in-covid-cases?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">help was on the way</a>. It pledged to send therapeutics, rapid diagnostic test kits, ventilators, and PPE, as well as the raw materials required to produce AstraZeneca’s vaccine. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other countries including the UK, France, Germany, and Pakistan are also sending supplies.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The situation is desperate: </strong>On Sunday, coronavirus cases in India climbed to a record high for the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/25/us-pressed-to-lift-export-ban-to-help-india-fight-surge-in-covid-cases?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fourth straight day</a>. Reports describe patients dying in hospitals due to lack of oxygen and funeral pyres lighting up the sky. Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the second wave, fueled by the variant B1617, had “<a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/india-coronavirus-cases-set-new-global-record-us-readies-help-2021-04-25/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shaken the nation</a>.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One action the US has <em>not </em>taken is to send India the AstraZeneca vaccines it had stockpiled. Yesterday, Dr. Fauci <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-25/u-s-to-consider-sending-india-unused-vaccine-doses-fauci-says?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> releasing those vaccines, which are not yet approved in the US, is going to be “something that is up for active consideration.”</p>

<tr>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/26/nomadland-wins-big-hopefully-final-pandemicera-oscars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Well...That Was Weird
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/26/nomadland-wins-big-hopefully-final-pandemicera-oscars" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Oscars sign" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80ODU5L29zY2Fyc19zaWduLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chris Pizzello-Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night, the 93rd Academy Awards gave us an <a href="https://variety.com/2021/awards/news/anthony-hopkins-best-actor-oscar-upset-1234959766/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">awkward moment</a> to nearly rival Adele Dazeem or the <em>La La Land</em>/<em>Moonlight</em> mixup.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>While typically the Best Picture category closes out the show, the producers swapped the order so that Best Actor would go last. The late Chadwick Boseman was the odds-on favorite to win the award, in which case the event would close on a poignant note. But he didn’t win—Anthony Hopkins did—and Hopkins wasn’t even in attendance. So the entire show ended as abruptly as a Zoom meeting. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, that wasn’t the only notable thing about last night’s Oscars, which was hosted in a number of locations including Union Station, LA’s iconic transportation hub. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>Nomadland</em></span><span> had a big night. It won Best Picture and Chloé Zhao became the first woman of color to win Best Director. Zhao is only the second woman ever to win the award, after Kathryn Bigelow earned it for </span><span><em>The Hurt Locker</em></span><span> in 2010.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Mia Neal and Jamika Wilson became the first Black women to win an Oscar for makeup and hairstyling for their work in </span><span><em>Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Typically, Oscar season means big box office bumps for nominees and winners, but with many movie theaters under Covid restrictions the eight Best Picture nominees’ total earnings have barely hit <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-oscars-2021/2021/04/24/989633211/if-big-box-office-means-big-ratings-this-years-oscars-are-in-big-trouble?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$35 million</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fed meeting: </strong>Before Biden speaks, Wednesday afternoon Fed Chair Jerome Powell will hold a press conference following the Fed’s meeting. No big policy changes are expected. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data: </strong>Watch out for the Q1 GDP number on Thursday and inflation data on Friday. </p>

</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Friday is Biden’s 100th day in office.</span></li>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDYzL2ZhY2Vib29rX2FuZF9hcHBsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, Apple is rolling out its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/20/tech/ios-14-5-release-date/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eiOS 14.5 software update\u003c/a\u003e for iPhone users, including...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe ability to unlock phones with your face while wearing a mask\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e217 new emoji to express emotions you didn’t even know you had\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSupport for the new AirTag Bluetooth device tracker \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut there’s one particular iOS 14.5 update that’s less “oh neat!” and more “this could shake up the $105 billion mobile ad industry.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s called App Tracking Transparency\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith this new feature, apps will be required to ask for your permission to track your activity across the internet. That data is crucial to advertisers who want to use your internet history to show you ads you’re more likely to click on. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eProblem for advertisers is, when you ask someone whether they want to be tracked or not, the majority say no. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo why is Apple doing it? \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s part of CEO Tim Cook’s push to \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/22254815/facebook-apple-privacy-ios-14-lawsuit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadd more privacy features\u003c/a\u003e to Apple’s ecosystem. Here’s Cook at a privacy conference in January:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Technology does not need vast troves of personal data, stitched together across dozens of websites and apps, in order to succeed.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“If a business is built on misleading users, on data exploitation, on choices that are no choices at all, then it does not deserve our praise. It deserves reform.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSound like a business you know? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook took to App Tracking Transparency like a foot to a stray Lego piece. In a PR blitz following Apple’s announcement, it \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/02/26/971367875/why-is-facebook-launching-an-all-out-war-on-apples-upcoming-iphone-update?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargued\u003c/a\u003e that small businesses would be hurt without the ability to send users targeted FB ads. Whether Facebook’s ad biz will be dinged as much as it says it will is unclear, but other apps like Snap and Bumble have \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-04-23/apple-s-new-iphone-privacy-feature-may-help-facebook-google?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarned\u003c/a\u003e that Apple’s moves could be harmful.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eApple’s aggressive privacy measures are putting competitors on the back foot, but they could also invite even more antitrust scrutiny to its dominance of the app economy. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter taking a mostly “not my problem” approach to India’s brutal second wave of the coronavirus, yesterday the US said \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/25/us-pressed-to-lift-export-ban-to-help-india-fight-surge-in-covid-cases?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehelp was on the way\u003c/a\u003e. It pledged to send therapeutics, rapid diagnostic test kits, ventilators, and PPE, as well as the raw materials required to produce AstraZeneca’s vaccine. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther countries including the UK, France, Germany, and Pakistan are also sending supplies.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe situation is desperate: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Sunday, coronavirus cases in India climbed to a record high for the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/apr/25/us-pressed-to-lift-export-ban-to-help-india-fight-surge-in-covid-cases?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efourth straight day\u003c/a\u003e. Reports describe patients dying in hospitals due to lack of oxygen and funeral pyres lighting up the sky. Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the second wave, fueled by the variant B1617, had “\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/india-coronavirus-cases-set-new-global-record-us-readies-help-2021-04-25/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshaken the nation\u003c/a\u003e.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne action the US has \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003etaken is to send India the AstraZeneca vaccines it had stockpiled. Yesterday, Dr. Fauci \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-25/u-s-to-consider-sending-india-unused-vaccine-doses-fauci-says?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e releasing those vaccines, which are not yet approved in the US, is going to be “something that is up for active consideration.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast night, the 93rd Academy Awards gave us an \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2021/awards/news/anthony-hopkins-best-actor-oscar-upset-1234959766/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px mixup.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile typically the Best Picture category closes out the show, the producers swapped the order so that Best Actor would go last. The late Chadwick Boseman was the odds-on favorite to win the award, in which case the event would close on a poignant note. But he didn’t win—Anthony Hopkins did—and Hopkins wasn’t even in attendance. So the entire show ended as abruptly as a Zoom meeting. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, that wasn’t the only notable thing about last night’s Oscars, which was hosted in a number of locations including Union Station, LA’s iconic transportation hub. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eNomadland\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e had a big night. It won Best Picture and Chloé Zhao became the first woman of color to win Best Director. Zhao is only the second woman ever to win the award, after Kathryn Bigelow earned it for \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Hurt Locker\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in 2010.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMia Neal and Jamika Wilson became the first Black women to win an Oscar for makeup and hairstyling for their work in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMa Rainey’s Black Bottom\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong
